description: The Maharashtra government on Wednesday (January 28, 2026) announced a three-day period of State mourning

title: 'Border 2' box office, day 7: Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty film eyes Rs 300 cr worldwide
description: The patriotic drama 'Border 2' is dominating the box office, nearing Rs 300 crore globally. After a stellar opening, the film has amassed over Rs 213 crore net in India within six days.  Despite a weekday dip, its powerful narrative and action sequences continue to draw audiences, promising further milestones.

title: Accused in murder case of gangster Goldy Brar’s cousin shot dead in Punjab’s Mohali; Brar booked
description: Mohali police booked foreign-based gangster Goldy Brar for the murder of Gurwinder Singh alias Lambbad, who was shot dead outside a court where he had come for an opium case hearing

Ajit Pawar plane crash: Baramati lacked IMD services; visibility below ideal landing norms: experts
description: A recent plane crash, claiming the lives of deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar and four others, has ignited concerns over aviation weather protocols. The incident highlights potential gaps in pre-flight briefings for chartered flights and landing visibility standards, particularly at smaller, non-IMD-jurisdiction airstrips like Baramati.

Month-long Festival begins on February 1 | Unique art district turns 10: Come February, LAD will become a living canvas
Shocking! 'Not feeling respected': Yuvraj reveals why he left cricket
description: Yuvraj Singh revealed that he retired from cricket in 2019 because he stopped enjoying the game and felt a lack of respect and support. Speaking on a podcast, he said he had nothing left to prove mentally or physically. Yuvraj also recalled early doubts about his talent but said he no longer takes them personally.

title: Stricter SWM rules notified: Residential societies, government-run buildings to local bodies will have to process solid waste at source

MCD revised budget focuses on dog shelters, pollution control
Man, accomplice arrested in Gurgaon for allegedly tricking woman into marriage, pressuring her to convert

Ajit Pawar’s plane crash: ‘It’s over, what is left… Baramati has been orphaned’
Can international patent law handle a permanent space presence?
description: Patent law rests on the principle of territoriality: patent holders have exclusive rights within specific jurisdictions, and authorities assess infringement by locating where acts such as making, using or selling have occurred. Outer space destabilises this logic

title: The Doomsday Clock shows the danger but not the way out
description: Tthe clock banks on the idea that if you show people a sufficiently frightening picture of their future, they will demand change. But history is clear that this strategy is flawed

title: Baramati plane crash: Wristwatch, sitting position help cops identify Ajit Pawar’s body
description: Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's body was identified after a Learjet 45 aircraft crashed near Baramati. Police used his wristwatch and familiar seating position to confirm his identity. The aircraft departed Mumbai and was on final approach to Baramati when the incident occurred. Pilots reported runway visibility issues before the crash.

title: Delhi Confidential: Friendly Fright
Time stops at 8.44am in Baramati, Pawars’ hometown unites in time of grief to salute Dada
description: Baramati mourns the tragic loss of its beloved leader, Ajit Pawar, who died in a plane crash. The town, known for its unwavering support for the Pawar family, came to a standstill as residents expressed profound grief. Ajit Pawar's dedication to his constituency and his people was evident in the outpouring of sorrow and tributes.

title: Serena Williams admits mom guilt as she’s softer on Adira than Olympia
description: Serena Williams told Today with Jenna & Sheinelle on January 28, 2026, that she sometimes feels “too nice” to her youngest daughter Adira. The tennis icon admitted she has to check herself to stay fair with Olympia. The moment showed a softer, honest side of Serena as a mother.

title: Two heritage structures in Egmore IOG to undergo much-needed makeover
description: The ante natal outpatient block and the Gifford School are set to undergo major restoration at a cost of ₹11.02 crore by February-end; Officials said the buildings had suffered 40% - 50% damage

title: Bangladesh says 'no security risks'; clears shooting team for India travel
description: Bangladesh's shooting team has been cleared to compete in the Asian Rifle and Pistol Championships in India, despite the nation recently citing security concerns to withdraw its cricket team from the T20 World Cup. The government believes the indoor shooting event poses no significant security risks. The championship is scheduled from February 2 to 14 in New Delhi.

title: Once accusing PCB of unpaid dues, ex-Pak head coach joins new PSL side
description: Jason Gillespie has been appointed head coach of the new Hyderabad franchise in the PSL, marking his return to Pakistan cricket after resigning as national Test coach in 2024. His appointment comes amid a dispute with the PCB over unpaid dues, which the board has denied. Gillespie had earlier cited poor communication and management decisions as reasons for his resignation.

title: Guindy station redevelopment nearing completion, says Southern Railway
description: Facilities, including new toilets, lifts and parking, have been built under the Centre’s Amrit Bharat Station scheme; a footbridge for EMU passengers to access Metro Rail to be ready in two months

title: Sweet, friendly: Delhi remembers pilot Pathak
India all too familiar with mindless brutality, we emphatise with those who undergo same tragedy: Foreign Secy Misri
Supreme Court defends Aadhaar as identity proof for SIR
‘Very disappointed’: Scott Bessent hits out at Europe over India-EU trade deal
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expressed strong disappointment with European nations over their new trade deal with India. He criticized Europe for prioritizing trade interests over supporting Ukraine, particularly after India continued to purchase Russian oil and its refined products, which Europe then bought.

title: U.S. agents involved in fatal Minneapolis shooting placed on leave
description: Donald Trump has called for an “honourable and honest investigation” into Pretti’s death and suggested he would “de-escalate a little bit”

title: ‘Ajit (Pawar) dada would always listen even if issue was very local’
No more extension for filing SIR claims, objections in West Bengal: Supreme Court
Small passenger plane crashes in northeast Colombia, killing all 15 people on board
description: A small passenger plane carrying 15 people crashed in Colombia's Norte de Santander province on Wednesday, resulting in no survivors. The aircraft, operated by state-owned Satena, lost contact with air traffic control shortly after departing from Cúcuta. Local officials discovered the crash site in the village of Curasica.

title: Opposition: President’s address has no substance, a recycled ritual
God, governed by devotion
No need for physical Aadhaar copies as new app enables digital verification
Youth will get many opportunities due to historic EU FTA: PM Modi
'For official use': Indian-origin CISA director uploaded sensitive government files to ChatGPT
description: CISA's acting director, Madhu Gottumukkala, uploaded sensitive "for official use only" contracting documents into the public version of ChatGPT last summer, triggering multiple security warnings. Despite the non-classified nature of the files, the incident prompted an internal review by DHS officials to assess potential harm to government security.

title: Federal Reserve keeps interest rates unchanged even as Trump continues to insist they be lowered
description: A key issue facing the Fed rate-setting committee is how long it will remain on hold; they remain split between those officials opposed to further cuts until inflation comes down and those who want to lower rates to further support hiring

title: Justin Bieber returns to Grammy stage after 4 yrs
description: Global sensation Justin Bieber is returning to the stage at the Grammy Awards 2026 after a hiatus, thrilling fans with his first major performance since 2022. He's nominated for Album of the Year and other categories. The star-studded event also features Sabrina Carpenter, Clipse, and Pharrell Williams, alongside a special showcase for Best New Artist nominees.

title: 188 million children and adolescents living with obesity worldwide: WHO
description: For the first time, the number of overweight children has surpassed underweight children, the global health body says; children spend a significant portion of their day in school, making it a critical setting for shaping lifelong dietary habits and reducing inequities in nutrition

title: Nicki Minaj calls herself Trump's 'No. 1 fan'
description: Rapper Nicki Minaj has publicly declared herself President Trump's "No. 1 fan," vowing to support him despite criticism.  Trump, in turn, lauded Minaj as "the greatest" and announced a new savings initiative for children, with Minaj reportedly investing significantly. This program aims to provide financial support for young Americans' futures.

title: Ray J hospitalized with heart issues after years of partying and drinking
description: Rapper Ray J has revealed doctors warn his "time is limited" due to severe heart damage, functioning at only 25% capacity. He attributes this to years of heavy drinking and partying, leading to a recent hospitalization for pneumonia and heart pain. Despite travel warnings, he plans a trip to Haiti for treatment, hoping to survive.

title: Goyal hits out at Congress for raising concerns over India-EU FTA
description: “I only hope my friend will shed this negative and pessimistic approach, which is unable to see our aspirational people raring to go out and do business with the world,” Mr. Goyal said

title: Jarren Duran’s Boston role in doubt as Red Sox eye Astros’ $6.6m star
description: Jarren Duran’s role with the Boston Red Sox is uncertain as the team explores a possible trade for Houston Astros infielder Isaac Paredes before the 2026 season. Reports say a return deal could take shape during spring training. Boston also keeps an eye on shortstop C.J. Abrams as another potential roster move in the offseason trade market.

title: Ajit Pawar’s long march in Maharashtra politics: From Baramati strongman to the CM chair he missed
Viral rumor linking Rui Hachimura to Doja Cat debunked by fact check
description: Los Angeles Lakers player Rui Hachimura has addressed rumors linking him with rapper Doja Cat. A viral social media post sparked speculation after the two were reportedly seen at a private dinner. Hachimura directly denied the claims in a comment on the post. This puts an end to the ongoing gossip surrounding the two celebrities.

title: Fifty years ago | Plan for India’s own communication satellite
Tom Brady romance with Alix Earle stirs after her cryptic vacation comment
description: Tom Brady, the NFL legend, and 25 year old Alix Earle have sparked chaos after they were spotted together at a New Year’ Eve, with her hand rubbing his back. With Tom Brady’s ex wife Gisele Bundchen remarrying for the second time, it seems Tom Brady has now moved on with his life. Despite the chaos, Tom Brady has remained silent about it and now Alix Earle has opened up about what happened.

title: From NY to TN: Smithsonian museum returns Chola, Vijayanagar bronzes to India — all you need to know
BLACKPINK Rose reveals dating status recalls disguising as old lady
description: Rose, the dazzling star of BLACKPINK, recently opened up about her romantic life, saying, "Denying would feel so dishonest." While she cherishes her privacy to protect those closest to her from the harsh glare of fame, she recounted a hilarious moment when she donned a grandmother disguise to escape the public eye.

title: Three held for duping retired Army officer
Gurugram schools receive bomb threats, declared hoax after search
description: The hoax mail’s origin has been traced to U.S. even as over a thousand of police personnel, five bomb detection and security officials conducted extensive searches Wednesday

title: Ajit Pawar's death in plane crash an accident, don't bring politics: Sharad Pawar

title: St. Columba’s School responsible for death of student, states SIT
Beloved Patriots fan dies shortly after Kraft’s Super Bowl ticket moment
description: A devoted Patriots fan and former nurse, Shelly Sepulveda, passed away from ovarian cancer on January 26, 2026, just hours after the team clinched a Super Bowl berth. Owner Robert Kraft had gifted her tickets weeks prior, a moment of immense joy during her two-year battle. Shelly, a mother of six and dedicated foster parent, found solace in football.

title: A hundred years ago | Staggering profits in Calcutta jute industry
Revisiting Tubelight: Why Salman Khan’s most tender performance deserved more love
description: In a career spanning over three decades, Salman Khan has become synonymous with swagger, mass appeal, and larger-than-life heroism. From action-packed blockbusters to whistle-worthy punchlines, his stardom has often been powered by spectacle. Yet, hidden beneath the loud triumphs is a film that dared to be soft, vulnerable, and deeply human — Tubelight (2017).

title: St. Columba’s School responsible for death of student, states SIT
Bill Belichick’s HOF snub deepens after reported NFL job loss
description: Bill Belichick, the North Carolina Tar Heels’ head coach, has recently failed to receive the Hall of Fame win sparking chaos among fans. But it seems the situation just got worse for him and many believe it might be related to his 24 year old girlfriend, Jordan Hudson. Bill Belichick was being linked to the position of head coach in the Buffalo Bills, just a few days ago. But it seems no NFL team is reportedly interested in the former New England Patriots’ general manager.

description: WRD is expected to get loan assistance from the World Bank. It has presented about 40 projects, including one for augmenting the storage capacity of the Poondi reservoir. The project will improve resilience to droughts and floods

description: Speaking to reporters, BPCL’s Business Head for Gas Rahul Tandon added they have already spent ₹8,000 in their 26 operational geographies

title: Tamil Nadu approves strict guidelines for equine registration and welfare
Lakers vs Cavaliers injury report: playing, injured, questionable, stats
description: The Los Angeles Lakers face the Cleveland Cavaliers on January 28, 2026, with both teams battling injuries. Key players like Austin Reaves and Adou Thiero are out for the Lakers, while Cleveland misses Evan Mobley and Darius Garland. Despite absences, both teams are winning, setting up a crucial matchup where supporting casts and rebounding will likely decide the victor.

title: ‘He’s got a gun’: US agents involved in Pretti’s killing placed on leave amid outrage, report says
description: A preliminary DHS report indicates two federal officers fired their weapons during the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis. The report, based on CBP documents and body-camera footage, states an officer yelled "He's got a gun!" before a Border Patrol agent and a CBP officer discharged their firearms.

title: Intel, which has US government as its largest shareholder, makes a promise for ‘Trump accounts’
description: Intel will match the US government's $1,000 'Trump Accounts' contribution for eligible children of its employees. This initiative, part of a 2025 program, aims to foster early wealth-building for youngsters. Intel's CEO highlighted the company's commitment to investing in its people and families, building on existing support for STEM education and employee benefits.

title: It’s scary to think where India will be in five years’ time: Sarah Taylor
description: Former England wicketkeeper Sarah Taylor, the fielding coach of Giants in WPL-4, says that the Women in Blue are making rapid strides due to the exposure they are getting; feels that the franchise leagues have made women’s cricket more exciting and competitive

title: Who loses when teachers are attacked
description: Teachers learn to adapt and survive, as seen in many state universities, while continuing to draw their salaries. The real victims will be the students and their parents, who will pay the ultimate price through poor-quality education, unsafe campuses, and the need to migrate elsewhere.

FBI searches Fulton County elections office in Georgia — what we know
description: FBI agents conducted a search at the Fulton County elections office near Atlanta on Wednesday, a move officials confirmed as a court-authorised law enforcement action. This development occurs amidst heightened FBI activity, reportedly aligned with President Trump's concerns about the 2020 election. Trump has consistently alleged the election was stolen, despite official findings to the contrary.

title: PWL | Delhi downs Mumbai, keeps semifinal hopes alive
Ranji Trophy | A wounded Karnataka will be on the hunt for a knockouts spot
description: After a calamitous performance against MP, the visitors will have their task cut out when it meets Punjab; Rahul, Prasidh will be keen to fire

description: The proposed sixth reservoir for Chennai near Thiruporur should be built by striking a balance between development and protecting livelihood issues of all stakeholders.

‘Not an act of war’: Marco Rubio defends Venezuela operation at Senate hearing — what he said
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio clarified the Trump administration's stance on Venezuela, stating military actions were not an act of war and no further intervention is planned. He also addressed Iran, emphasizing a defensive posture despite increased military presence, and noted the complexity of potential regime change. Discussions also covered Ukraine and Cuba.

title: Gauhati High Court lists PIL amid Assam vote row
description: The State unit of Trinamool Congress writes to the Chief Justice, seeking suo-motu cognisance of communal statements by public functionaries

description: Two-time former MLA from Wardhannapet Aroori Ramesh returns to BRS after quitting BJP

title: India vs New Zealand, 4th T20I: Abhishek Sharma has an off day, concern about Sanju Samson increases, as Kiwis pull one back
Hockey analyst says Maple Leafs unofficially eliminated after losing streak
description: The Toronto Maple Leafs face a grim playoff outlook after a significant loss to the Buffalo Sabres. The team is now eight points behind wild card positions. With only 29 games remaining, hockey analyst Jason Gregor suggests the season is effectively over for Toronto. General Manager Brad Treliving must now decide the team's direction before the trade deadline.

title: CM calls for steps to expand Sanjeevani Project across A.P.
description: The initiative was launched as a pilot in Chittoor district to monitor health data, says Naidu and proposes task forces to create health awareness

title: Class XI student dies during treatment in Nagapattinam; kin allege medical negligence

description: More than 70,000 people, mostly women and children, have fled a region in northwestern Pakistan near Afghanistan

title: Going to aggressively pursue exploration in deepwater areas, says ONGC Exploration Director O.P. Sinha
description: Mr. Sinha pointed out to policy support from the government and greater opportunities among the reasons for enhanced tilt to deepwater exploration

title: Uttarakhand horror: 25-year-old woman offered lift, raped in moving car; two arrested
description: In Rudrapur, two men have been apprehended for allegedly raping a 25-year-old woman inside a moving car. The survivor reported being offered a ride to work, only to be driven around and assaulted before being left in a secluded spot. Police swiftly arrested both suspects and recovered the vehicle used in the crime.

title: Death toll in Kolkata warehouse fire climbs to 16, West Bengal Govt announces compensation
description: Senior officials of West Bengal Fire Department have also pointed out that there were no fire license and no fire safety arrangements at the warehouse . Questions have also been raised as to how warehouse could operate in the ecologically sensitive area of East Kolkata Wetlands, which is also Ramsar Site

title: Dr Madhu Chopra shares throwback picture with late husband serving in the Indian Army; says, ‘These years shaped the way we raised Priyanka and Siddharth’
Chess’s future in Esports World Cup remains bright
'Wanted guys to take responsibility': SKY rues after India’s 50-run loss
description: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said the team deliberately chose to chase and play with six batters to test itself under pressure after a 50-run loss to New Zealand. He called it a learning experience ahead of the World Cup. New Zealand posted 215, while India were bowled out for 165 despite strong knocks from Shivam Dube and Rinku Singh.

title: AYUSHEXCIL, Zepto sign MoU to improve access and quality assurance for Ayush products
description: Union Ayush Minister, Prataprao Jadhav, stated that innovation-driven Indian startups are playing a critical role in improving last-mile access to trusted wellness products

description: The government noted that treatment of in-patients in private facilities involves longer clinical engagement, which may adversely affect the delivery of services in government hospitals

description: Political leaders, party workers and well-wishers express shock over Ajit Pawar’s sudden death; crowds throng Baramati to pay last respects to NCP leader

title: Punjab Police Crackdown: On radar, gangsters’ relatives who help identify targets, mediate ransoms, shelter shooters
4th T20I: Shivam Dube's fireworks not enough as New Zealand floor India by 50 runs
description: Shivam Dube blazed away with a fifty of the highest quality, but his lone assault was not enough to save India from a 50-run defeat against New Zealand in the fourth T20I on Wednesday. Chasing a daunting 216, India were bowled out for 165, despite Dube’s superb 65 off 23 balls (3 fours, 7 sixes), as the visitors pulled the series back to 3-1.

title: Larsen & Toubro Ltd. Q3 net profit falls 4% to ₹3,215 crore

Will Budget 2026 provide clarity on cryptocurrency taxation, simplify compliance?
description: India's booming crypto market, awaits clarity in Union Budget 2026. Following stringent measures in Budget 2025, including a 30% flat tax and 1% TDS, experts urge for nuanced rules on loss set-offs and asset classification. While some anticipate reforms, others foresee continued aggressive taxation, emphasizing compliance.

title: American Cancer Society finds improvement in 5-year cancer survival rate
description: Cancer survival rates have significantly improved globally, with the US seeing a 70% five-year survival rate. India, however, lags behind with a 30-35% rate, largely due to late diagnoses, and systemic issues. While some cancers like breast cancer show better outcomes in India, lung cancer remains a major challenge, says Dr. Sachin Trivedi.

title: Travis Kelce supports Taylor Swift amid legal troubles as wedding plans pause
description: Travis Kelce has become a steady source of support for Taylor Swift as she navigates emotional strain linked to ongoing legal troubles around her inner circle. While staying publicly silent, Swift has leaned on Kelce’s guidance to protect her peace, set boundaries, and address personal tensions directly, even as wedding plans remain on pause.

title: Japan's second richest man 'drops' plan to spend $50 billion on buying American company
description: SoftBank's Masayoshi Son has reportedly halted talks to acquire US data center operator Switch Inc., a move that impacts his ambitious Stargate AI infrastructure plans. The $50 billion deal, crucial for generating computing power for OpenAI, faced internal concerns over its size and logistics. While a full acquisition is off, discussions for a partial investment or partnership continue.
